Platform.Title: JCL_Ecoli_1
Platform.Manufacturer: James C. Liao's Metabolic Engineering Laboratory, UCLA
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Oligonucleotides from Operon AROS E. coli set, were printed on Corning UltraGAPS slides.

Sample.Title: E. coli wt control DPTA Sample1 TechRep1

Channel.Source: E. coli mid-log aerobic 37C in MOPS glucose
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA extracted by hot phenol choloroform folled by Qiagen RNA Midi column.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Samples were directly labeled by direct incorporation of labeled dCTP

Channel.Source: E. coli 5 minutes after the addition of DPTA
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Added DPTA
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA extracted by hot phenol choloroform folled by Qiagen RNA Midi column.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Samples were directly labeled by direct incorporation of labeled dCTP

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Samples were hybridized as specified in the Corning UltraGAPS manual. Slides were blocked and washed as specified in the Corning UltraGAPS manual.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing with a Virtek/BioRad scanner.
Sample.Description: Cells were grown in MOPS media/0.5% glucose and aerobic conditions.
Sample.Data-Processing: Quantification of the scans were performed with ImaGene (Version 6.0.1; BioDiscovery; El Segundo, CA; www.biodiscovery.com); with the results presented in the associated text files. The normalized data VALUE was generated using LOWESS normalization with rank invariant selection, as implemented in lcDNA (receptor.seas.ucla.edu/lcDNA; Hyduke DR, Rohlin L, Kao KC, Liao JC. 2003 A software package for cDNA microarray data normalization and assessing confidence intervals. OMICS 7(3):227-234.)

Channel.Source: E. coli cysB- mid-log aerobic 37C in cys-supplemented MOPS glucose

Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA extracted by hot phenol chloroform followed by Qiagen RNA Midi column.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Samples were directly labeled by direct incorporation of labeled dCTP.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Samples were hybridized as specified in the Corning UltraGAPS manual. Slides were blocked and washed as specified in the Corning UltraGAPS manual.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing with a Virtek/BioRad scanner.
Sample.Description: Cells were grown in MOPS media/0.5% glucose and aerobic conditions.
Sample.Data-Processing: Quantification of the scans were performed with ImaGene (Version 6.0.1; BioDiscovery; El Segundo, CA; www.biodiscovery.com); with the results presented in the associated text files. The normalized data VALUE was generated using LOWESS normalization with rank invariant selection, as implemented in lcDNA (receptor.seas.ucla.edu/lcDNA; Hyduke DR, Rohlin L, Kao KC, Liao JC. 2003 A software package for cDNA microarray data normalization and assessing confidence intervals. OMICS 7(3):227-234.)

Sample.Data-Processing: Quantification of the scans were performed with ImaGene (Version 6.0.1; BioDiscovery; El Segundo, CA; www.biodiscovery.com); with the results presented in the associated text files. The normalized data VALUE was generated using LOWESS normalization with rank invariant selection, as implemented in lcDNA (receptor.seas.ucla.edu/lcDNA; Hyduke DR, Rohlin L, Kao KC, Liao JC. 2003 A software package for cDNA microarray data normalization and assessing confidence intervals. OMICS 7(3):227-234.)

Sample.Title: E. coli metJ GSNO Sample2 TechRep2

Channel.Source: E. coli metJ- mid-log aerobic 37C in MOPS glucose
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA extracted by hot phenol chloroform followed by Qiagen RNA Midi column.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Samples were directly labeled by direct incorporation of labeled dCTP.

Channel.Source: E. coli metJ- 5 minutes after the addition of 500uM GSNO
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Treated with 500 micromolar GSNO for 5 minutes prior to harvesting
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA extracted by hot phenol chloroform followed by Qiagen RNA Midi column.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Samples were directly labeled by direct incorporation of labeled dCTP.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Samples were hybridized as specified in the Corning UltraGAPS manual. Slides were blocked and washed as specified in the Corning UltraGAPS manual.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing with a Virtek/BioRad scanner.
Sample.Description: Cells were grown in MOPS media/0.5% glucose and aerobic conditions.
Sample.Data-Processing: Quantification of the scans were performed with ImaGene (Version 6.0.1; BioDiscovery; El Segundo, CA; www.biodiscovery.com); with the results presented in the associated text files. The normalized data VALUE was generated using LOWESS normalization with rank invariant selection, as implemented in lcDNA (receptor.seas.ucla.edu/lcDNA; Hyduke DR, Rohlin L, Kao KC, Liao JC. 2003 A software package for cDNA microarray data normalization and assessing confidence intervals. OMICS 7(3):227-234.)

Series.Title: Identification of GSNO response network in E. coli
Series.Summary:
This project used transcriptomic analysis of the S-nitrosoglutathione (GSNO) response in E. coli, and associated regulatory mutants, to identified the molecular targets of and response to GSNO during aerobic growth in minimal media.
Keywords: Comparative genomic response
Series.Overall-Design: Samples were treated with either 100 or 500 micromolar GSNO and the 5-minute response was analyzed. The resulting transcriptome data was analyzed with network component analysis (NCA) to identify perturbed regulators and pathways.
